header.gameNote: LAS VEGAS CLASSIC AT LAS VEGAS NV

article.headline: New Mexico 89, Colorado 76
article.story: LAS VEGAS -- Dairese Gary and Kendall Williams scored 18 points apiece as New Mexico defeated Colorado 89-76 Wednesday night to advance to the championship game of the Las Vegas Classic. Williams also had 11 assists for the Lobos (10-1), who won their eighth straight game and will play Northern Iowa on Thursday in the tournament final. Phillip McDonald added 14 points, Drew Gordon had 10 and Alex Kirk pulled down 10 rebounds. Alec Burks had 25 points to lead the Buffaloes (7-4), who will play Indiana in a consolation game on Thursday. Marcus Relphorde added 13 points and Levi Knutson and Cory Higgins each had 10. New Mexico, which never trailed in the game, led 41-33 at halftime and by as many as the 13-point final margin. The Lobos shot 61 percent (30 for 49) from the field and 42 percent (5 for 12) on 3-point attempts. Colorado shot at a 47 percent field goal clip (27 for 58), but hit just 5 of 22 3-point shots.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.
